description: Unknown; perhaps from an African language (possibly Yoruba ófé (“to evade, disappear”)). Pig Latin for foe, though popularly posited, is probably not accurate.
A possible point of origin is Cab Calloway's Hepster's Dictionary, where the word is defined as "Policeman or law enforcement, 'The Man'".

adjectives.description: ofay (comparative more ofay, superlative most ofay)

examples: ‘Baby,’ April Elgar said, ‘you may be an uptight ofay milk-toast limey bastard, but you ain’t no fag.’

entries.meaning: (US, ethnic slur, slang) A white person.
examples: Synonyms: honky, whitey; see also Thesaurus:white person
